page.title: 14FAUNA OF MARK MOOR
page.content: Mammals living & breeding here are badgers, foxes, rabbits, hares, brown rats & wild mink which are increasing in numbers. Water voles & shrews live near the rhynes & it is known that there are otters though declining in number Insects, butterflies breed freely & up to 22 species have been recorded, willows & buckthorn provide an ideal habitat. Dragon & damselflies abound near the waterways. Grasshoppers & crickets in the grassland areas. Waterbeetles abound, 80 species exist here but many are endangered. Fish exist in the water rhynes & waterways. The fishing rights are owned by the Lord of the Manor & all anglers must have a licence to fish. Fishing provides the only sport in the area & is for coarse fish & eels.
